website_summaries.verdict: High-quality paper that is ideal for everyday use, whether you print with an inkjet or laser printer. Made by a top brand in the paper industry.
pros: Durable paper that can be used in both inkjet and laser printers
Thick enough to reduce see-through of most ink
Colors stand out on the bright white finish
Certified by the Forest Stewardship Council
Available in single or multi-pack reams
cons: Won't work for all double-sided printing tasks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for printing both sides with an inkjet printer. Photos don't bleed through.
customer_reviews.text: I just took on the responsibility of publishing the monthly newsletter for my astronomy club. I wanted to print the newsletter on both sides and also wanted to include lots of photos. I'm using an inkjet printer, and most printer papers I've used would bleed through the paper wherever there's a photo. This paper does not bleed through. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: M.Reed

customer_reviews.title: Best paper for inkjet printers
customer_reviews.text: My inkjet printer paper of choice for 10 years. The 24-pound weight greatly cuts down on jamming, as inkjet rollers get a better grip than they do on standard 20-pound copy paper. The bright white finish makes color images really pop, and there's far less ink soaking when duplex printing is used. There are brands with equal quality, but cost way more. Hammermill gives me top paper at a better price.
customer_reviews.author: MdniteEagl

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but HP Premium 32 was nicer, bit more $$
customer_reviews.text: I tried out 5 different papers for laser photo printing. This one was $9 a reem as opposed to $12 for the 2 others but was lighter in weight, 24lbs, as opposed to the other at 32lbs. Of the 24 lb ones I tried, this was the best for the lowest price. The overall best of the 5 was "HP Premium 32" for $12.79 for 500 sheets. It was the whitest and heaviest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Everyday Paper
customer_reviews.text: -Hammermill 105050 Inkjet Paper- I really dislike thin, cheap feeling paper. This paper is the perfect thickness and feels great to handle. It is a crisp, cool white. It also doesn't have the coating of treated papers which might be suitable for some applications (like when you want a bit of a glossy look for documents with photos), but for normal every day printing this is perfect.Documents with photos still look pretty decent. I actually don't like the scratch feel of those coated papers. Good price, value. But the best thing is- NO Jams. No Issues - Recommended - Will Repeat
customer_reviews.author: Deep Thought

customer_reviews.title: Good & Plentiful
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this choice. The paper is sturdy and bright and the five reams are a great choice because I use a lot of paper. Printing on this paper is a total upgrade from the regular 20-pound, flimsy paper I used for years. Watch out for price changes, however, but still, the cost is lower area stores, and delivery to your home or business is a much better option than transporting a somewhat heavy box. Also, the packing was solid. Both the box and the individual reams were undamaged in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Len Hollie

customer_reviews.title: Mottled appearance
customer_reviews.text: This paper does have a very faint lavender hue as another reviewer mentioned. I doubt it would be noticeable if I wasn't directly comparing it to other pieces of white paper. Compared to my last ream of 24lb copy paper (Xerox Bold), this has a mottled, uneven appearance and is not as smooth.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kaput

customer_reviews.title: Great paper.  24 lb. copy paper makes the text and photos pop on the page.
customer_reviews.text: Great paper. Makes the text and photos pop on the page. 24 lb paper is so much nicer than the normal 20 lb. copy paper. It is more expensive than the 20 lb. paper, but if you have a project that you want to look extra special, try this paper and I am sure you will agree!
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-purpose paper
customer_reviews.text: I've used this particular Hammermill paper in an Epson inkjet for years. It's consistently a good weight and the price from Amazon is better than I can find locally on the same product. I frequently do double sided printing and never have a see-through problem. It never looks off color or allows bleeding. No, it's not fancy watermarked linen, but it's good enough that I'm never embarrassed to use it for formal correspondence or a résumé.
customer_reviews.author: LittleSara

customer_reviews.title: Good quality paper.
customer_reviews.text: This is good quality paper which I use in my inkjet printer. The paper is thick enough that one might think you have two sheets. Excellent print quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karl59062

customer_reviews.title: Paper is great - delivery, not so much
customer_reviews.text: I ordered just 1 ream of paper. It's great paper and works well in my Brother laser. The problem is Amazon sent the ream in a plastic shipping envelope instead of a box or a sturdy mailer envelope. By the time I got it, the wrapper around the paper had been torn up pretty bad and the paper was "loose" inside the shipping envelope. I ended up tossing out about 30 sheets because they were creased/damaged, but was able to salvage the rest of the ream. I'm using the paper for home use so it's still usable even though the entire ream is a little "scuffed". Amazon pick/pack needs to do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Better for double-sided printing than 20 lb. paper
customer_reviews.text: 24 lb. paper is better for double-sided printing than 20 lb. paper because the image on the other side doesn't show through as much. However, it does show through to some extent. If you want paper that doesn't show anything from the other side, you'll have to go heavier than 24 lbs. This Hammermill paper is the first 24 lb. paper I have purchased, so I don't know whether it hides the image from the other side better or worse than other brands. All I can say is that it is better in this regard than 20 lb. paper.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Very substantial, heavy weight paper
customer_reviews.text: My last pack of paper was from WalMart & half the price of this - that paper was very flimsy, but it was fine for my needs. This paper is much heavier, thicker, & I was afraid it would clog my 10 yr old HP printer - but a "test" print was fine. If you are looking for a heavier, thicker, higher quality pack of paper, this is a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Rescue Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laser paper
customer_reviews.text: We love this paper we've used a similar product in the past it feeds good no jams and always has good quality prints. When Joy using this paper and our brother business laser printer, we use it for small business, homeschool worksheets, print off, and for everyday use. We usually by full reams but this time we bought a half ream because we are trying to be more frugal and save money by printing on both sides of the paper using the printers two-sided function.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: Heavier weight paper is always better
customer_reviews.text: I don't think people understand the value of using a heavier weight paper even for everyday printing. The difference between 20lb and 24lb is huge and the heavier weight is especially useful for printing documents going out into a construction site. Print outs just hold up much better to all of the abuse. This is also at a good price, and the heavier weight is worth the extra couple of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: R. S.

customer_reviews.title: This paper works well with my Brother Color Laser
customer_reviews.text: The paper appears to be very nice quality, proper heaviness and good "feel". I have already gone through nearly the first ream and have had no problems at all. Additionally, I have an Epson inkjet printer that handles this paper quite well. Both printers support duplex (both sides) and I have had no problem with any duplex operations.
customer_reviews.author: MacWiz

customer_reviews.title: Good all around printer paper
customer_reviews.text: This is a good all around printer paper, and I really like the heavier weight of it. Makes letters more durable, makes anything printed look more professional. I've been using it for two years now, and still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Janis Ian

customer_reviews.title: Markedly different from my previous brand's paper with same specs.
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is very good, it feels smooth and moves easily through my printer when duplexing. However in comparing it to my previous brand's paper with exactly the same specs, (1) it is not as white, having a definite cream tint and (2) it is noticeably lighter than the previous 24# paper I was using. Since I was careful to select a paper with the same specs as the paper I had before, I'm disappointed in my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Not premium at all
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing premium about this paper. Compared to other high-quality paper brands, this is much more rough, less bright, and simply lower quality
customer_reviews.author: dudewhobuysalottastuffonamazon

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using XEROX 24lb Laser paper for Years. Thought I would try another brand that I thought was gonna be as Nice as the XEROX Paper. This didn’t even com close. It doesn’t have the Body / Stiffness that the XEROX brand has and is not as WHITE in color. Kinda disappointed but I’ll have to Run these 2 Reams out and go back to the XEROX. GOOD AINT CHEAP, and CHEAP AINT GOOD. The old adage applies here for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: KENNY  D.

customer_reviews.title: prints with smudges on header section
customer_reviews.text: weight and brightness is great BUT kept printing with smudges on the header section (pixma inkjet). tried loading all 4 possible feeding directions and still the same. deep cleaned printer inks and under cartridge and still the same with test pages. put a sheet of my 28 lb (which i loved the thickness but hated the glossiness) in between and the smudges were present only on this paper. can't blame the printer if my in between test page of the old paper came out clean. had to be the paper and not the printer. maybe just this production batch?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great paper. I use it to print colored pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: Great paper. I use it to print colored pictures for a presentation and don't want the page behind it to bleed through it like the 20 lb. paper does.
customer_reviews.author: Art Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Feeds smoothly and has nice quality feel.
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty paper. Feeds smoothly through my Brother laser jet printer. Nice looking black and white print jobs. Have not used for color prints simply because I don’t really do any color printing.
customer_reviews.author: btt118

customer_reviews.title: My favorite printer paper
customer_reviews.text: My printer is a Brother MFC-J5520W inkjet. I find 20# paper flimsy and "cheap" and have tried a number of brands of 24# paper. This one has become my go-to favorite. It has sufficient brightness to provide good contrast with text and graphics, enough weight to prevent bleed-through and shadows, and sets the ink quickly and smoothly. I can recommend it for general use without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Compumom

customer_reviews.title: Great 24lb paper, good value for 500 ct.
customer_reviews.text: I've been printing a lot of study materials lately and have been experiencing pages sticking together, and paper jams. I thought it was my machine, however, I've been printing today with this paper. I even did a two sided job and no jams, no sticky pages or blanks. The weight/thickness is okay for two sided printing. I'm happy with the paper, and it was the best deal at the time of purchase for 500 ct.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really, really nice
customer_reviews.text: This really is nice paper. We got this after doing research to find the "ideal" paper weight for making paper airplanes and gave it as a Christmas present to a 7 year-old. Almost a shame to use it for that, as the paper is truly beautiful. Well-made, perfect weight and white balance. Would steal some should I ever need to print out something professional-looking in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Exact same paper as chain store for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.text: Was buying the same paper at the chain of office supplies that fastens paper together;). I was spending just under $60 before tax. Very happy. I was concerned about the reviews mentioning quality and see-through issues and have not experienced this so far. (Will update if I do before the last ream is used up). Used two reams so far and have not experienced any of the other reviewers issues. Highly recommend you purchase this paper if you have any presentation or care about your printer.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this paper. Paper has good weight, doesn't misfeed in my printer, and is a good brightness. When looking for paper as I was finishing my taxes, saw so many with disappointing reviews. Thought this one had fewer issue that would negatively affect my timely tax printing needs. Performed like a champ. I only use about two reams a year at home. But will look for this paper again next year.
customer_reviews.author: paco

customer_reviews.title: No printer jams!!
customer_reviews.text: A few months a go, I bought the Amazon basics 20 lb. Good value, but my printer started jamming regularly. Even after I cleaned all the rollers, etc. it was still very sketchy. Rather than buy a new printer or repair this one, I decided to try this 24 pound paper. Voila! Doesn't clip the edge of the insertion feed any great print.
customer_reviews.author: Oakland David

customer_reviews.title: jamming in all my printers
customer_reviews.text: I really don't get it. This paper is jamming all my printers. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: This is the best paper for inkjet and laser
customer_reviews.text: I use this in both my Samsung laser and Epson inkjet printers, it works beautifully in both and never jams. I really like the feel of this slightly heavier 24lb paper. These 5-ream cases are cheaper than buying individual reams and the case protects the paper edges better during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When I first ordered this item it was a good deal
customer_reviews.text: To reorder this product I now have to pay over 11.00, and my first order was 9.99. Why on earth would I EVER order this again from Amazon? I've found this to be true on so many items that I've ordered in February 2020, and now there are no "good deals" anymore. I have been ordering from Amazon for convenience, rather than the good pricing I've received in the past. PRIME CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.author: Karen Biafora

customer_reviews.title: It's white, Its Right and it works cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Had more expensive paper for "inkjet" printers and they were not this quality. It's a nice feeling paper for wanting to make an impression with resumes and cover letters. Husband prints on it for his business and the white is bright enough to stand out and not too bright you don't want to read it. Holds the colored ink well without bleeding.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Poston

customer_reviews.title: CHECK YOUR FINAL CART, SIZE MAY BE SWITCHED
customer_reviews.text: I'm a leather worker. I order my letter patterns online. They are almost always designed to be printed on A4 paper. I use A4 paper which is almost the same as 8.5x11 paper but it is not the same! Getting a standard, 8.5x11 paper does no good. I might as well turn this into firelighters for all the good it will do me.
customer_reviews.author: Howdy!

customer_reviews.title: Why use 24 lb paper instead of 20 lb.
customer_reviews.text: I switched to a heavier weight (24 lb) paper because the common weight (20 lb) paper was getting jammed in my printer when printing on both sides. Haven't had that problem since. Also the cost is made-up by not loosing sheets of paper when the lighter sheets would get jammed. Has been a better3 deal all around.
customer_reviews.author: annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Quality Paper. Whiter Color.  Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Copy paper is copy paper, right? No. This copy paper was a great value (with coupon). And yes, it is brighter than other paper. Picture shows the brightness comparison. Good value. Better price than the big box office supply stores too. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TexShop

customer_reviews.title: High quality paper at an impressive cost
customer_reviews.text: I found this paper to be economical and very inkjet friendly in my Canon Inkjet printer. I have this on subscribe and save so one ream will last me a couple of months. This is a cost effective alternative for me than the recycled brands of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cheryl Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great paper!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Xerox paper from Costco but they don't carry it anymore. It was bright white and had great feel and all my printers loved it. But Hammermill has a great name so I ordered two reams. Great paper. Not as white as the Xerox but good, substantial paper and everything looks great in print. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Good all-around paper
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. I didn't need the higher brightness so I purchased this. It was delivered on time and as described-packaged very well. My printer would prefer a bit thicker paper but as an all around use with different printers in is a great price. I will order the next up-grade for a thicker paper next time.
customer_reviews.author: A. CoCo

customer_reviews.title: Good paper quality with good instructions
customer_reviews.text: Although it's not as thick as I thought it would have been, the paper quality itself is excellent, bright, and very smooth. If you want a paper that does not bend when hold at one end, get the 32lb paper. Instructions are also helpful in that it tells you which side of the paper is optimized for printing on - meaning this won't be the best choice for double sided printing.
customer_reviews.author: YB

customer_reviews.title: Packaging less than stellar
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. No issue with product itself. The ream arrived and outer box was fine. The corners of the paper were crimped, making feed into printer jam. Had to rotate the paper opposite to move crimped corner to rear. Packing was just two air pack cells. The contents must have banged around the entire trip.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Securo

customer_reviews.title: if you are looking for a thick paper for 2 sided printing, do NOT buy this paper
customer_reviews.text: This is good for normal printing. Not recommended for business brochures. and certainly not for double side printing. it is not as thick as I thought it would be. not good enough for inkjet printer (although it says "premium inkjet & laser"). price is good but I would not recommend this to anyone. if you are in need of a good printing paper for normal use and limited to 1 page printing, go ahead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good price, thick paper
customer_reviews.text: Good price compared to all other outlets I have shopped. Watch the weight numbers - 97 is a HEAVY/THICK paper stock. That is as advertised, but when you make multiple copies you have a "thick" stack of paper to tote around.
customer_reviews.author: WJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth the premium!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Really, really white - Makes black toner "pop" - Feels very professional when holding, due to it being heavier - Works well with laser printers Cons: - More expensive than other paper - Slightly higher chance for jamming (I assume it's due to it being heavier)
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: Paper Quaity Makes A DIfference!
customer_reviews.text: I have used cheap paper for computer printing forever. I decided to try Hammermill Premium Inkjet & Laser Multipurpose Paper. I am so glad I did-- it's the best ever. I used to frequently have paper jams, such a pain! It's a rare episode to have a jam with this paper. Worth the price just in lessening my frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Beje

customer_reviews.title: Love Hammermill
customer_reviews.text: As a commercial artist, I've used a multitude of different papers for different purposes. I've always found Hammermill to be top-notch!
customer_reviews.author: ThinkmanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my HP inkjet printer
customer_reviews.text: This paper works just fine with my inkjet printer. It hardly ever jams and the print comes out clean and crisp. I never have smudging and do not have to wait a long time for the ink to dry on the paper. This is a good weight paper and works for all my home office needs.
customer_reviews.author: cctyger

customer_reviews.title: Snazzy paper, versatile, not the cheapest
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy elegant paper--24 pound just looks and feels better than the usual 20 pound copy paper. Inkjet.paper has a different set of qualities from laser paper, but this straddles the gap nicely. More expensive than lesser paper, but the quality shows. Good for light users
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Mann

customer_reviews.title: Jams Printer.
customer_reviews.text: The paper clumps together and constantly jams my printer. Or pulls multiple pages through at the same time. I’m so disappointed and wish I could return it. I haven’t had this issue with any other paper but it is consistently happening with this paper unfortunately. It’s really challenging and frustrating. Sadly, I wouldn’t purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie O’ + Co

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice of Paper
customer_reviews.text: I have never used this paper before and I figured I’d give it a try due to all the positive reviews. I’m very satisfied that I purchased it! The paper has a nice “thickness” to it and the ink prints very clearly and crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weight paper
customer_reviews.text: I hate thin copy paper and have tried many times to find the right weight paper. This is perfect - not too thick and not too thin. Excellent quality and brightness. I want my invoices to look professional, and this paper makes it happen!
customer_reviews.author: Zech

customer_reviews.title: Good paper, good quality
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Works good. I don’t honestly notice a huge difference other than the ink doesn’t bleed through like cheap paper does. For example should you do front and back print on one paper it won’t show from the other side
customer_reviews.author: @fivefreespirits

customer_reviews.title: Good, fairly heavy paper for general printing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a general-use paper with some weight for use in printing book-length texts in addition to general usage. This paper is exactly what I was looking for. Stands up well to staple-binding into a book, thick enough to print double-sided with minimal bleed through.
customer_reviews.author: Checquers

customer_reviews.title: Thick and heavy, porous paper
customer_reviews.text: This is high quality paper. It is heavier than most cheap paper you get in offices. My only complain is that it is actually quite porous and it makes it thicker than necessary, this is good for paper for inkjet printing, but personally I like denser and smoth paper that is also heavy but not as thick, however that kind of paper is not good for inkjet.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob Culebro Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Simply excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have an Epson Expressions inkjet printer, and this Hammermill paper is the ONLY brand that my printer likes. I end up with crisp and bright print quality every time. And the price is wonderful as well.
customer_reviews.author: StardustGypsy

customer_reviews.title: Only paper I will use!
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight of this paper. Great print quality. I hate see-through paper, and this paper looks great for home or professional use, plus the value for 5 reams is great. I will continue to purchase this paper!
customer_reviews.author: Tara A

customer_reviews.title: Great and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a similar paper that I thought was a good value, but when I tried to re-order, it was out of stock. So I looked for an alternative. This was even a better value, but the paper is as good or better than what I was using before. It is a heavy, bright paper that makes great copies at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Ammann (Lillie)

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality inkjet paper, and plenty of it
customer_reviews.text: I've used Hammermill products for years and years, and I finally figured that it would make the most sense to buy a case of inkjet paper. This isn't their highest quality paper, but it's perfectly fine for virtually all applications. Using inkjet paper rather than trying to get by using copy paper makes your life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon M. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: Been using Hammermill paper for years. This has worked in Inkjet printers from Brother, HP, Epson, and Lexmark and never had an issue with the paper. Works great and prints look good.
customer_reviews.author: Grimmace

customer_reviews.title: This paper is vey poor quality for color copies!
customer_reviews.text: From the text on the offer I assumed this would be great quality for my color copies. WRONG!. it is very poor quality for color copies. It is OK for black print. Don't buy this paperl
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Best paper I have used so far!
customer_reviews.text: Paper has great quality feel prints well because of it’s paper feel is not slick and grabs well for no paper jam. You pay for what you get and your printer will love you for it.
customer_reviews.author: jturk

customer_reviews.title: this has been the worst I bought
customer_reviews.text: I read so many positive reviews that I decided to buy this paper. I have a translation company, and I use a variety of high-quality paper at work. So far, this has been the worst I bought. It feels cheap, it's see-through, some pages are dirty, smeared (not caused by the printer).
customer_reviews.author: OMAR ROMERO

customer_reviews.title: Packaging Issue
customer_reviews.text: The plastic band was so tight around the box that two (2) of the paper reams on top (under box lid) were squeezed so tight the paper was warped. I pulled out all reams and placed the 2-bad reams on bottom of box and placed good reams on top of them. My hope is the ream weight will press with warped ream paper to become more flat. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: William Adams

customer_reviews.title: much better then cheap paper
customer_reviews.text: this paper is much better than cheap 5 dollar paper at store. I thought it was my printer but it was my paper. the quality of the paper really makes a difference. Very smooth finish.
customer_reviews.author: Bossman

customer_reviews.title: Top quality and bright color.. Bought a pack ...
customer_reviews.text: Top quality and bright color.. Bought a pack when on special. Several weeks later stated using paper. The superve quality of paper was noticed and commented by colleagues... Makes an impression..
customer_reviews.author: RobertN9

customer_reviews.title: Damaged goods
customer_reviews.text: Hammermill box damaged and 1/2 packet of paper damaged beyond use. Amazom box was fine so this was not done in shipment. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected at a great price and fast shipping. If your spending money on ink and printer the outcome will only be as good as the paper
customer_reviews.author: Bikers56flh

customer_reviews.title: Great paper for drawing in pen!
customer_reviews.text: I like the brightness and smoothness of this paper. I use it for drawing in pen!
customer_reviews.author: B. POLITO

customer_reviews.title: I use this paper with my Canon MB5420
customer_reviews.text: So I got this fancy new Canon high-end inkjet printer, and since I use it very little, I was afraid to buy anything but the high resolution paper for it so I wouldn't damage it. But I finally wanted to use a paper that didn't cost so much so I finally tried this paper out. It works fine.
customer_reviews.author: lighten_up_alreadyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this paper top practice hand lettering with my tombow markers and other brush lettering! The brush pens glide across the paper so well! A must if you hand letter!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Decent paper, but not inkjet coated
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly decent paper for the price, but it has no inkjet coating despite being marketed as "ColorLok". It just looks like ordinary office paper.
customer_reviews.author: blenheimears

customer_reviews.title: Printer paper
customer_reviews.text: Printer paper is printer paper. It is what it is. Because I to not get out of the house much is the reason I purchased on line. This paper works well, so would probably purchase again if the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: GPS P Bultema

customer_reviews.title: Great paper
customer_reviews.text: We love this paper. It excepts printing very well and we love the feel of the paper. I don’t think we will ever go to any other type of paper
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Best inkjet paper I have tried yet
customer_reviews.text: Thick, quality and bright paper. I didn’t know there was different types. Always will be using this paper and the value is better then most others.
customer_reviews.author: allthingsG

customer_reviews.title: the only paper i use for my small nearly-paper-free office.
customer_reviews.text: the only paper i use for my small nearly-paper-free office. No jamming, low dust, great print quality. Quantity presentation quality pages, stock is not too heavy, yet doesn't feel cheap. Packaged tightly in plastic so it doesn't tend to get impact damaged or water damaged during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Company in Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Great for inkjet.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and bright. Smooth finish. Takes ink well for graphics and text without bleeding. Just feels nicer than average 20# paper.
customer_reviews.author: Japdawap

customer_reviews.title: Best quality copy paper that $17.50 can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I mean it’s paper. A little thicker & higher than I’m used to so I feel fancy and when I get things off the printer. This uppity feeling has in turn helped with my overall confidence & improved my dating life too. Basically it’s miracle paper.
customer_reviews.author: MITCHTAFER

customer_reviews.title: Great quality paper
customer_reviews.text: I ran out of paper in the middle of printing. I put in the Hammermill paper to finish the print job. I could definitely see a difference. The printing on the Hammermill paper was clearer and much easier to read. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: shelschneider

customer_reviews.title: Really Frustrating Paper
customer_reviews.text: This paper sticks together when the printer grabs it and then I end up with the first inch of my page printed on one sheet and the rest of the page printed on the next. Really frustrating for large print jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Thicker paper but not as nice kind as in copy store
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this kind of paper for good quality for keepsake or for file. So I will not buy this kind of paper again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Yes, this is the BEST paper
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST paper I have ever felt or seen. It feels like I have a new laser printer. This is quite wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday paper for my inkjet printer.
customer_reviews.text: The paperweight is just right for my normal printing using my inkjet printer. For 500 sheets the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: vicki odum

customer_reviews.title: Truly the best
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product before from the same seller and I am not disappointed. Great business people and deliver on their promise of quality, delivery date and price. I will use this merchant again and again. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo Blues

customer_reviews.title: "This is the good stuff! "
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper daily. I once took something into a print shop to have several booklets made and the gal working there commented on the paper saying, "This is the good stuff!"
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Ann

customer_reviews.title: very happy. I'll be buying this paper again
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a bit heavier than I expected and I am very, very happy. I'll be buying this paper again. I am a photographer and print contracts and forms for my clients. This paper makes it look and feel a little more professional than the really fine paper.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Raye

customer_reviews.title: Best paper for Brother MFP
customer_reviews.text: Got a small, dinky Brother MFP for my home office, and this paper, with its slightly thicker, heavier stock gives me a better image, text quality, faster drying, and less jams than any other. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Grijalva

customer_reviews.title: For ANY printing that needs quality paper, HAMMERMILL has what you're looking for!!
customer_reviews.text: I use HAMMERMILL Papers for all printing that has any import at all. Best foot forward and all that.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my laser printer.
customer_reviews.text: Good paper, however I thought 24lb was thicker than regular paper. Still a good buy and I'm satisfied even tho I'm an idiot.
customer_reviews.author: Bmac

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with dark spots all over it
customer_reviews.text: Paper arrived with dark spots all over most of the sheets. I'll never buy Hammermill products again.
customer_reviews.author: Bithabus

customer_reviews.title: No more paper jams!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a paper that does not jam my inkjet printer!
customer_reviews.author: Jmax

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality paper
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality paper. Bright, prints well, shipped quickly, packaging holds/stores paper well, while you use the paper. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: mfethers

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Canon inkjet printer!
customer_reviews.text: Using with a Canon printer with aftermarket ink - no issues at all. Not doing high accuracy color prints, but everything printed in color looks as it should. Deep blacks, bright whites, no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight and feel.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality paper. Double sided printing was much better with this weight. Looks clean and professional.
customer_reviews.author: keep it simple

customer_reviews.title: The paper is a top quality paper and the price is very reasonable!
customer_reviews.text: I just like to have a nice crisp, white paper amd this certainly fits that description. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great paper for the money
customer_reviews.text: The weight and brightness of this paper is otstanding. The small increase in price is well worth the gain in quality IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Turner

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my Epson Ink Tank, loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This paper solves my problem of having to wait for ink to dry before highlighting. Definitely will by again!
customer_reviews.author: Don Tawanpitak

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived open
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived with the Hammermill cover split open and several sheets of paper were bent and dirty. It looks like it was sealed broken apart in the shipping envelope. Unfortunately I had to use this paper immediately and I had no choice but to sort the bad sheets and toss them at my expense.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Good, clean paper
customer_reviews.text: No issues, arrived fine, nice weight and brightness for any use. Came in its own box, so good storage for the unused reams. Would get it again.
customer_reviews.author: C-L

customer_reviews.title: Great paper.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality paper for our old inkjet printer. Quality print every time and practically no jams. Smooth and nice.
customer_reviews.author: EZMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal Ever
customer_reviews.text: I like this paper because it does not jam in my laser printer as the less expensive paper tends to do. The price of a single pack for this type of paper is pretty high so buying the 5 ream box was such a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Atumi

customer_reviews.title: Inkjet Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This price keeos going up but it is very good paper. Paper in general may be seeing price increases.
customer_reviews.author: NL Quatrano

product_meta.title: Hammermill Premium Inkjet & Laser Multipurpose Copy Paper, 24lb Copy Paper, 8.5 x 11, 1 Ream, 500 Total Sheets, Made in USA, Sustainably Sourced From American Family Tree Farms, 97 Bright, Acid Free, 166140R, White
product_meta.description: Size:1 Ream| Style:24Lb Ink - LaserThe Hammermill Paper 99.99% Jam-Free Guarantee: You will not experience more than one jam in 10,000 sheets using Hammermill copy paper on your high-speed digital printer or we will replace your Hammermill paper purchase. We test more than 13.5 million sheets of paper every year to make sure that each sheet is consistent. Then we test our papers on all kinds of printer and copier equipment to ensure that our paper will work well for you, every time, on every machine. MAKE SURE IT’S ORIGINAL HAMMERMILL QUALITY: look for “Ships from and sold by Amazon” at the top of the page, under the product title. “It’s More Than Just Paper” to us and to millions of sustainable forestry workers across America, including American family tree farmers. Hammermill papers are made with renewable resources from certified sustainably managed forests. We want our business to last for generations and that means taking good care of our environment. This Hammermill inkjet & laser color copy paper is a premium paper designed for color-intensive print and copy use on all color inkjet and laser copiers and printers. This multipurpose pear prints high-quality documents that look like professionally-printed pieces. It is available in 24 lb 8.5 x 11 letter size paper. Hammermill Premium Inkjet & Laser Multipurpose Paper is available in a single ream (500 sheets of paper), and in a 5 ream case (2,500 sheets of paper). Choose from items listed at top of page in size and style name.
feature_bullets: Made in USA - Hammermill copying and printing paper is 100% made in the USA, helping to support 2.4 million sustainable forestry jobs in America, including family tree farmers. Hammermill is more than just paper. See images.
99.99% jam-free guarantee - You can trust Hammermill paper quality, guaranteed. Scroll down to view the product description for details. See images.

Other paper options – Scroll down to compare Hammermill print and copy paper for every purpose including premium presentation-quality color copy paper, cover-weight paper stock, glossy paper for photo printing, and 15 pastel shades of multipurpose copy paper.

Colorlok technology & acid-free - Colors on Hammermill copy paper are 30% brighter; Blacks are up to 60% bolder, and inks dry 3 times faster for less smearing. Acid-free Hammermill paper also prevents printing and copier sheets from yellowing over time to ensure long-lasting archival quality. See images.

Renewable resource - Did you know you are helping to replant forests when you buy Hammermill paper? Original Hammermill copy paper is Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) certified, contributing to “MR1 Performance” for paper and wood products under LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design). See images.
Make sure it’s original Hammermill quality - Look for “Ships from and sold by Amazon” at the top of the page, under the product title.
